reviews.text: We had 2 rooms. The first being a single room which was actually a full bed, big enough for 2. The room itself felt a bit cramped because you can only get in on the bed on one side since the room isn’t that big, but it was perfect for just one person. It had a desk and a flat screen t.v. There is also a safe and a mini bar fridge. There was a window facing the inside of the building with no special view just of other walls. The decoration is modern yet minimalist with wooden panels on the walls and great lighting. The bathroom was very spacious with marble tiles, a regular sized bathtub and bidet. We spent 90 euros a night for this room. The other room was a twin room with 2 small beds. The room itself was spacious and had a small balcony facing the back of the building. The closet space was double the size of the single room. All the other amenities were about the same. We paid 112 euros a night for the twin.
reviews.title: Great Value, Convenient Location With No Smoking Floors

likes.liked: — Everything I anticipated from the hotel web site proved to be the case

reviews.text: Hotel Preciados was the perfect hotel in Madrid...Our family of 4 just spent 2 wonderful nights in Madrid at this hotel. From check in to check out, everything was perfect. From the very attentive bellboy to the box of chocolates that welcomed us in our bedroom and the sumptuous breakfast.... I could not ask for more..... and did I mention the free minibar...
reviews.title: Perfection in Madrid

reviews.text: The location is unbeatable... we walked to Palacio Real, Plaza Mayor and even to Cibeles Square to watch the worldcup finals.... That was a once in a lifetime experience....
reviews.title: Best location, outstanding hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a junior suite which was able to accomodate a family of 4 (2 adults and 2 teenagers). The rooms are beautifully appointed with a contemporary touch. The bathroom had double sinks, a bidet, a shower and a bathtub... Everything felt brand new. This was my kids favorite hotel in Spain and that is saying a lot(we stayed at Alfonso XIII in Seville and Hotel Regina in Barcelona).
reviews.title: Great Hotel in a good location

reviews.text: Please note that if you are driving you can actually drive to the front of the hotel although the road looks like it is only for pedestrians.... We made this error when we first arrived, but soon learned from the hotel staff that we could have driven in to the front of the hotel... Despite this minor hiccup, everything else at the Preciados was perfect.
reviews.title: A First Class Hotel in City Centre

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although we were on the First floor with balconies that faced a really busy street, the noise did not really bother us even on the night Spain won..
reviews.title: Great hotel and best location!

reviews.text: We stayed 3 nights at Hotel Preciados. It is close to the metro so easy to get to and to get around Madrid. The rooms were large and modern and the breakfast was extensive. The front desk proved very helpful in arranging tickets. The waiters in the adjoining restaurant took the time to interact with our family. Compared with the other hotels we stayed in in Italy and Spain, the hotel offers very good value for the money.
reviews.title: beautiful hotel, good value!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 4 nights, earlier this month, and have no complaints. The room was clean, quiet, and the A/C worked well, even on the hottest day. There is a metro stop adjacent to the hotel, and you are a short walk from the Puerta del Sol. We found the staff to be most helpful.
reviews.title: Preciados = Perfect

reviews.text: The mini bar is free. If you drink that dry, there is a Mini-Mart across the street from the hotel, which is open every day until midnight. There is a flat screen TV in the room, with several English language channels. Our rate included a most copious buffet breakfast.

reviews.text: I was given room 001 on my first visit- what a disaster! Although a beautiful and spacious room, it's adjacent to the hotel restaurant's kitchen, and you can clearly hear the clanking of dishes and other kitchen noises on one side until late at night. Worse, literally underneath the room's windows are several dumpsters/recycle bins into which glass bottles and other items are continually dumped until at least 2:30 in the morning. Believe it or not, the trash collection truck empties these bins at around 2:45 AM, right outside the window! The room appears to have no soundproofing, and sleeping was next to impossible.
reviews.title: Noisy and so-so location, but nice property
Great Location -- Clean rooms
reviews.text: On my return visit I was given a different room on the second floor. Opening up the double set of doors onto the small but nice balcony clearly showed how much soundproofing had gone into this room. Still, loud shouts from drunk teens in the adjacent street could be heard until almost until 3 AM. Also, the touristy pedestrian mall and the nearby plaza seemed to fill up with sketchy-looking characters around sundown; I'm not sure that I'd want to walk around the neighborhood at night. Still, the staff was nice and helpful, and the rooms are a good value if you don't mind the noise and location that's not near anything in particular.
We had a Junior Suite -- 2 rooms. Excellent room and bathroom.
reviews.title: Excellent location

reviews.text: Breakfast was also very good.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay for our family of 5

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very Central location
reviews.title: Elegant hotel with helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved Preciados - very clean, roomy, QUIET (difficult in a city like Madrid) and so centrally located. The room was super modern - huge bathroom, too, and this electric shade that completely blocked the light (we didn't figure out how it worked until the last night, unfortunately)! Breakfast was pretty good - for some reason we only got it on the last night. If we were in Madrid again we'd definitely stay there - no question at all. Exactly what we wanted.
reviews.title: Great place, great location

reviews.text: We booked based on TripAdv reviews and were not dissappointed. Great location just off of Grand Via, next to a Metro stop, at the top of a pedestrian only shopping area on the way to Sol. We stayed on the first floor (no need to wait for the elevators) and there was virtually no street noise (blocked by 2 sets of double paned doors leading to a small standing room only balcony). On check-in the front desk staffed offered tourist advice without needing to be asked (awesome). Standard room size for 2 with large comfortable beds that got tight when we asked for a 3rd bed. Adequate closet and drawer space. My 13" laptop fit in the in room safe.
reviews.title: Great service (mostly)

reviews.text: We stayed here for just one night and we were pleased with the hotel. The bellman came out to the taxi to help us with the luggage which was helpful because the taxi could not drive to the door of the hotel. Our pleasant visit started with him, The front desk reception was very nice as well. The front desk receptionist was able to to provide us with tips on things to see and do the night we arrived and gave us solid directions to get around. We went to the rooms where we shown around by the bellman - he guided us through the two rooms we booked. He explained the contents in the mini bar were free - what a pleasant surprise! We took the waters and hit the town. Both rooms were very clean, comfortable in size and a terrific value. We had a drink in the hotel lobby bar and had good service there too. We would stay here again. The location is terrific and the whole experience was quite good.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

reviews.text: We had trouble finding the hotel (driving from the airport), but it was well worth the three times we drove around the block. The location is perfect for walking to almost any tourist location. The location made it easy to go anywhere. We were a group of six and had 3 rooms - While the rooms, are a bit small- but not by European standards- They are truly well designed and comfortable and modern- there is even plenty of closet space and the bathrooms are very nice, roomy and comfortable. What was impressive was the great customer service: the warm and welcoming staff. This was our first stop of a two week trip and some where along the way, I lost the names of those staff members who deserve to be mentioned by name. The front desk staff ( maybe Oscar?) the doorman who took care of our car and of course the young woman in the restuarant in the morning who even made us especially prepared expresso. Have to mention the incredible spread for breakfast. There was so much to choose from and all was tasty. We had a young hearty eater in our group who really enjoyed the expansive and delicious breakfast selection. This hotel knows how to cater to its guest. They even offerred us tips as we headed out for the day. Without a doubt, we would stay here again- You are getting a great place for the price. They were a great start to our vacation. We recommend the hotel and it's wonderful, warm, and helpful staff
reviews.title: Great Hotel- great staff

reviews.text: Based on the reviews of the Preciados I was expecting more, a lot more. I'd rate this hotel average at the very best and pretty lousy versus the expectations I had. Quite a lot of issues even though it had some good sides as well.
reviews.title: Average at best, definitely not the best in Madrid

reviews.text: Spent three nights at the Preciados. The location of the hotel is absolutely excellent if you want to be in the very centre of Madrid. All the monumental places (Gran Via, Palacio Real, Puerta del Sol, Plaza Espana, etc. ) are within walking distance, more or less. Surprisingly, the location is rather quiet, also because the rooms have double windows . The old (around 1900?) building has been completely overhauled and now has extremely modern amenities, the rooms are modern style, clean. The four stars are well deserved. Everything, including bathroom, works very well. However, there is no coffee maker nor ironing board in the room. Bed is very comfortable. Staff is very friendly. Rooms are a bit small. There are rooms facing the street, but also rooms with no outside view (single rooms). There are many light switches, about 20, you have to identify before going to bed. Breakfast is charged separately at 15 euros plus tax, the buffet is mas o menos ok, but sometimes no waiter or waitress around. If you are not hungry and want to save money, there are a few bars in the vicinity that are substantially lower cost. In restaurant there is a smoking zone, but in the cafe section with the television, no smoking. The minibar appears to be free of charge, but we hadn't knew that, what a pity. The reception is helpful, they also arrange taxis e.g. to the airport at regular price. But to conclude, we really enjoyed the sojourn at this hotel.
reviews.title: En el centro del centro - superbe location and comfortable

likes.liked: — Clean rooms fully equipped in central location
likes.disliked: — rooms a bit small, lobby in hotel a bit small

reviews.text: I am only writing this so that those of us spend our hard-earned money to travel half way around the world for a vacation or have to do so for business could have complete quiet at night so as to be able to recover quickly from jetlag after a couple solid nights' sleep. As I am always uncertain about how quiet a hotel really is (it's relative what constitutes quiet for a 19 year-old who parties until 5AM then passes out anywhere as opposed to a 39-year-old), I wanted to reassure you fellow globetrotters, this gem is truly very quiet.:)
reviews.title: Quiet Oasis in the middle of Madrid for quick recovery from jetlag!

reviews.text: The room: beautiful wood floors were squeaky clean, bed comfy with cozy down comforters, modern, clean bathroom and shower w/ great pressure, Ikea furnishings complete the room w/ clean lines while providing ample storage.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The fridge is stocked w/ quite a good selection of complimentary (you read it right - free! - this hotel is probably the only one of its kind left any where in the world...sad) beverages is heaven for the tired traveler no matter what time of day you get there. For the vacationer, it saves quite a bit of $, esp. considering how the US$ to Euro is so pitiful thanks to our weakened economy brought on by greed and poor ruling). Just carry a bottle or two each day before you head out. The hotel is central enough that you can return to your room mid-day for a quick break and to pick up more if it's warm out. And unlike what previous reviewers alleged, the hotel replenishes each and every bottle that you consumed the previous day up to the number of bottles that were in there to start with. And be a decent human being and buy more with your own money if you drank every bottle in the fridge after it's been restocked but before it's to be replaced the next day for gosh sake....
reviews.title: Great Hotel - better locations

likes.liked: — Super Location - clean, well kept room

reviews.text: The staff, while professionally courteous, are not the B&B type to bend over backwards to help you. So it's good to have your head screwed on and know what you're doing, where you're going, and know how to get there.

reviews.text: My finance and I stayed here for 4 days for my birthday. The hotel is in a great location in the center of the old town. Easy walking to many sightseeing attractions. We stayed in the penthouse suite for one night and it is absolutely fabulous. Well, worth the extra money for a special occasion. Afterwards, we moved to a deluxe room for 3 nights. Very clean but could use some paint and minor fixups. However, I would hightly recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

likes.disliked: — rooms need a little touch up

reviews.text: The Hotel Preciados is centrally located and within walking distance of the major sites in Madrid: Puerta del Sol, Teatro Opera, the Palacio Real, Catedral Almudena, etc. The staff was extremely helpful and was able to answer all of our questions. The rooms were clean and the bathroom was completely up to date. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a wonderful, charming hotel with a great price to match!! We stayed in 4 hotels during our 3 weeks in Europe, and this was the best deal by far. It's in a great location right by the Calle Preciados, which is a great place to be. The room was very large and simple - definitely no frills here - but there was nothing lacking. Comfortable bed, usable safe, good closet space, fridge with free drinks, a few computers downstairs (though no wireless). Our room overlooked a busy street but it wasn't very noisy at all. The staff was supercilious and really not very nice, so we tried not to have too much interaction with them, but we'd go back to this hotel again in a heartbeat.

The staff was very helpful, recommending a great paella restaurant to us, and booking a flamenco show for us to attend afterwards. The location was central, so we were able to walk everywhere, but public transportation was nearby if needed. And the minibar was free.

Beautiful hotel right in the center of Madrid
reviews.text: This was a great hotel in Madrid. We stayed for 3 nights, and spent 130 euros per night. It was definitely up to US standards for hotels. The entrance/lounge area was beautiful, our room was spacious, and the bathrooms were nicely updated.

reviews.text: This hotel is tucked away right beside the really busy Plazas in the city of Madrid. it is a handy walk to the Grand Via and all the action. The hotel rooms are on the small side but are clean and nicely styled. There is an older section of this hotel so if you want the more updated rooms you need to state this when you book. The breakfast buffet is sensational and should please all kinds of palates. The beds are comfortable but are in the usual European style of twin beds pushed together but much better than other places we have stayed in. All in all a really good value hotel with helpful staff.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel Friendly, Helpful staff

reviews.text: The building itself is beautiful, the free minibar service is an awesome addition, the location is perfect, the beds comfortable, the showers powerful, the price acceptable, the breakfast, well, Spanish ... All things considered this is an very good hotel.

reviews.text: My only fault was that I stayed during a Champions League fixture and there was quite a bit of noise from Galatasaray fans late into the night and the room didn't feel totally sound proofed.

It's a very good hotel, but it didn't have anything really outstanding (swimming pool, sauna, roof terrace, cool views, coffee machine, super fast wifi)... anything that really blew me away to think it warranted that accolade.
reviews.title: Lovely Boutique Hotel in perfect location
Very comfortable hotel in a central location
reviews.text: For our 5 nights stay we found that: The overall rank of the hotel is very good. Location is central so expect noise even if you close the double doors balcony in which one of them is double glassing. The service is more than excellent as well as the very friendly staff. Breakfast is great in particular the quality of foods and drinks add to that the free non-alcoholic mini-bar. The hotel is smartly designed even the tiny standard room. The only thing I do not like is the size of the room that is very small (the standard ones) and no even paid upgrade the answer for that is that “the hotel is fully booked”. Standard room is overpriced. We are not thinking to stay there again except in a junior suit.
The Preciados is in an excellent location, close to Grand Via, but in a quiet side-street. Very clean, pleasant and friendly staff. A good place to stay in Madrid.

Sound proofing was also an added bonus as it is very central and Madrid can be quite noisy in the early hours. Staff were friendly and able to give advice on city tours etc. Breakfast wasn't included and was quite expensive but we discovered a "Chocolaterie" round the corner so went there for chocolate and churros. Free mini bar was replenished daily! Ideally situated for exploring Madrid. We would definitely stay there again.

reviews.text: We had a pleasant stay several years ago and din't hesitate to try it again on our most recent visit to Madrid. We can happily report it has maintained its excellence. Our room was quiet and spacious by European standards. The staff were efficient, friendly,and helpful. No hesitation in recommending it.

We arrived at the hotel at 9am from an overseas flight. They had a room ready and allowed early check in. The room was average size but comfortable. Bathroom was very nice and huge fir Europe standards. Only one of our 4 hotels during this trip that had a vanity to accommodate toiletries. AC worked well.
reviews.title: Great location in a comfortable affordable hotel
good but perhaps over-rated?
reviews.text: Service was great. Always available to recommend restaurants (not just tourist locations) and provide directions.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location. We only used taxis to and from the airport, train station and once to go to Principe Pio to catch a bus to Segovia. There us a metro stop near for all other in city trips.
reviews.title: Great location, Overrated hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were friendly and helpful, the location is good and all the essentials (cleanliness, wifi, etc) are fine. Our rooms (301 & 401) were fine but a bit on the small side - they faced inwards so we could hear the lift gently going up and down all the time (but perhaps we were spared street noise?). All fairly reasonable given the price but my main complaint is that they try to gouge you with extras that should be part of the service, not expensive add ons. Two examples: the buffet breakfast is very good but it's expensive too, at 16.50 euros each; and the laundry bills are outrageous. I obviously should've checked the prices before i dropped my laundry off but assumed that the price would be in the ballpark. In fact, it was 55 euros for a smallish load - won't make that mistake again.
reviews.title: Central Location

reviews.text: This was rated 3rd on Tripadvisor when we booked and I can't believe there are 2 better hotels in Madrid. My wife, 16 year old daughter and I stayed in a spacious and comfortable room with very nice ensuite bathroom (although the whirlpool bath didn't work). The welcome on check in was efficient and quick. The porter brought our bags up and showed us round the room. The hotel has free wifi and free mini bar although the contents is limited. We had an excellent breakfast (also included). Any questions we asked of the hotel were answered and our only regret was that we stayed only 1 night (before going to Valencia - see review for Hotel Las Arenas). It was great to revisit Madrid after 25 years and we loved wandering from one tapas restaurant to another. The hotel is well situated for shopping on the Gran Via, as well as the Plaza Mayor and Puerta del Sol. If you are going to Madrid and want somewhere comfortable without being over the top, Hotel Preciados is the place.
reviews.title: Great location and great hotel

reviews.text: I found this hotel on Trip Advisor and the reviews were accurate. Great place to stay and free mini-bar was a plus. The staff was very accomodating. The location was perfect. Plenty of resturants around the hotel. Easy to get around from location.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel's location is very convenient. Short walk to puerto del sol ,plaza mayor, royal palace. metro stops very close by. Courteous, helpful staff. Our room was average, not much charm. Yes, free bar (mostly drinks) is nice, but if you are budget conscious, calculate average 15 euro in the drinks in the fridge. We were out and about all day I think we mostly drank water and 1 beer or soda at night. The extra charge for breakfast is worth it. Unlimited nespresso, wide selection of ham, eggs, different fruits. You can fill yourself up for brunch, and your next meal is tapas at 6 pm. I was going to give this hotel 5 stars but my minor complain is that the wifi is too slow. Sometimes the loading is so slow,you just give up surfing.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.text: Wonderful staff (helpful and courteous), great location (right next to the Royal Palace), very clean, nice food (we ate at their restaurant downstairs and had great Sangria and Paella), and quiet. We had a loft room with a balcony (surprise) and the views were an added bonus.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed there for 3 nights. I am very picky about hotels and so far this is the best hotel so far I have stayed in Madrid. Ask for Oscar in the front desk. During our check in process he showed us 3 rooms to select from and gave us a room selected before our check in time. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: One of the best

reviews.text: I read the review and chose this hotel....The result was fantastic...everybody in my family loved this hotel.. the service was so attentive... When we wanted to go to Atocha station helped us by calling a taxi and brought our lugguage to the taxi !!! many thumbs up!!! The bad thing was that they didn't include the breakfast in the accomodation price but I didn't care cos in the neraby area u could find great cafe!.. but would prefer to have breakfast in the accomodation's price.... u should try and u will love this property..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: PS. I love Mini bar...it's free and has loads of Coca Cola, orange juices, mineral water and beer!!!! Love it!!!
reviews.title: Would stay here again

reviews.text: We stayed at Hotel Preciados for thee nights in May 2007, and would stay here again if we ever came back. Great location, very quite rooms, clean, and helpful staff. The staff pointed us to an area away from the touristy restaurants that we visited every night.

reviews.title: loved the location
reviews.text: Very good central location, comfortable big rooms. On a quiet side street. Easy access to metro 2 minutes walk.

reviews.title: Couldn't have been better
reviews.text: Helpful staff - speaks english.

Chose Hotel Preciados based on this website’s reviews. Stayed here for five nights and was not disappointed. The location is ideal – walking distance to everything you want to see in Madrid. Despite being in the center of it all, it’s on a quiet street. Double windows ensure added soundproofing, a valuable asset, since everyone appears to stay out all night long. Our room (508) was on the top floor of “superior” rooms, which cost a bit extra but was worth it. Even though the room was tiny, there was great closet space, room for luggage, a peaked ceiling (which made it feel less claustrophobic), and a pleasant little terrace with rooftop views of quaint streets, spires from Plaza Mayor, and the top of the Opera House. Bathroom was all marble with double sinks and a sky-lit shower. Beds were extremely comfortable. Room was modern, uncluttered, and spotlessly clean. It was well maintained throughout our stay. Hotel staff was friendly and professional – that includes front desk personnel (all of whom cheerfully spoke English), bellhops and maids. Added benefits were free minibar in the room stocked with assorted bottled drinks, box of chocolates sent up on the second day, and free use of two computers in the downstairs meeting room. We didn’t eat in the hotel’s lovely restaurant, as there are plenty of places wherever you go. Would definitely stay here again and recommend it highly.
reviews.title: Clean, quiet, classy retreat in the center of it all.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a superior room and were not at all disappointed. It was a very cosy attic room with two small balconies. The room was very well kept and clean. We really liked the tasteful furnishing. Room and bathroom featured everything we needed and were well appointed. Minibar was free. The bed was very comfortable.
reviews.title: great rooms !!!

reviews.text: Location is good for first time tourists. It's a good place if you want to stay in the center of Madrid.
reviews.title: Lost in Madrid

likes.disliked: — restaurant in hotel was expensive (cheaper food around the corner)

reviews.text: Staff at the reception was not particularly helpful and generally rather stiff than friendly.
reviews.title: Perfect hotel in Madrid

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife, 10 month old, and I recently stayed at Hotel Preciados in September 2007. To make a long story short, we were looking for an apartment we had reserved and couldn't find it. Frustrated, we found Hotel Preciados in our Rick Steves guide book. Desperate, they gave us a room around midnight. We would have paid anything that night - our room cost us 140 Euros. They parked our car, brought up all of our luggage, and brought us a nice crib. The hotel is nicer than most European hotels. There's plenty of room, A/C, and the bathroom is spacious. It's also conveniently located in Madrid (and there's a Starbucks about a block away).
reviews.title: Delightful Hotel

reviews.text: This hotel is located in central Madrid. It has been updated lately and is generally very modern. Typical of a European hotel, the room is a little small but well appointed with good comfort. The bed was comfortable and staff very responsive. We found the hotel a good value convenient in central Madrid.
reviews.title: Well located update hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent two nights here in the "interior" Room 415--if having a room with only an "inside" window overlooking the inside of the hotel bothers you, don't stay in a "15" room. It didn't bother us at all--the room was very nice--a comfortable bed with a very firm mattress, the room and bathroom were quite large for a European hotel, the free mini fridge-bar was a nice feature (once we plugged it in), and it was absolutely silent at night. The wi-fi worked well, and there were also two computers to use for free in the basement if needed for boarding passes, etc. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. The hotel is reasonable walking distance from the Royal Palace and Plaza Mayor and many good restaurants and shopping opportunities are nearby. The special weekend rate was a steal for a 4* Madrid hotel.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel in Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Preciados exceeded our expectations. It is one of the most pleasand hotels we have stayed. The room is very chic and very clean. The location is great-able to walk everywhere. It also came with breakfast which was plentiful and delicious. In addition the staff is very friendly. I would highly recommend this hotel. If we are ever back in Madrid, this is where we would come. -also easy to get a cab to and from airport.
reviews.title: Really wonderful hotel in the center of Madrid

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a wonderful stay at the Hotel Preciados. Walking distance to so many things and convenient to the metro. Room was clean and comfortable. Good breakfast. The staff was friendly and helpful with restaurants recommendations and with hotels for other cities in Spain.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location, great staff.

reviews.text: This hotel was beyond our expectations. We reserved a suite for 3 nights (2 separate sleeping rooms) which was located at the 'bow' of the hotel - fabulous! What fun for my daughter and I to have our pictures taken in our hotel robes on the balcony (husband down on the street with the camera!). The room was immaculate, beautiful large bathroom with huge jacuzzi tub, free minibar, lots of closet space and very quiet (even during the political demonstrations in May). The front desk staff was unbelievably helpful and nice. We loved the buffet breakfast in the restaurant, the best we've had. The restaurant was great for dinner as well. The hotel location was perfect for walking to many major sights (e.g. Royal Palace).
reviews.title: Loved the hotel, location and service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thanks to others' reviews here, we decided on Hotel reciados for our five night visit to Madrid. The location could not be better to reach everything you want to in Madrid. Most of the major sights are within walking or quick Metro trips. Many good restaurants surround the hotel, so there's little need to venture outside the area if you don't have or need a car.
reviews.title: So glad I chose this one.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff are very helpful and friendly, ready to assist you with whatever you might need. They are multi-lingual, so don't worry about being understood. We noted many of the other guests were from numerous places outside Spain (we heard French, German and Italian) and all seemed quite content.
reviews.title: Excellent service, location and rooms!

reviews.text: The free mini-bar was a welcome amenity. I really thought it was a come-on but FREE mini-bars apparently exist! It was restocked every day, so water, beer and soda was always at hand- fantastic! Room was modest size but very clean and comfortable- just perfect for two of us.
reviews.title: Disastrous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurant in the hotel had some of the nicest wait staff we have ever encountered...could not have been friendlier or more attentive. A+
reviews.title: Splendid vacationq
amazing
reviews.text: What a wondefull surprise finding hotel preciados . The staff are friendly, helpful and courteous. The rooms are stylish and modern, the facilities are very much like a boutique hotel. wife and I were very pleased with our holiday there. Our room was bright, clean, large.We ll definatelly go back.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Preciados will not disappoint. This modern, well-managed, spotless hotel caters to both the business traveler as well as the tourist. My boyfriend and I travel frequently and are often disappointed with the standard "limited service" hotel, but not here. We stayed here for 5 nights during our trip to Spain and we’re very impressed. Hotel Preciado's new amenities, excellent housekeeping and welcoming staff make it a real stand out. In addition, the hotel is safe with 24-hour front desk service and centrally located with easy walking/taxi/metro access to all points of the city. One suggestion, request an upper floor room if possible as the street is busy and can be loud in the evening.
reviews.title: Highly, highly recommend Hotel Preciados!

likes.disliked: — ground floor rooms were TOO loud. We asked to be moved and were accomodated.

reviews.text: We took a 8 day trip of spain starting with madrid. Of all the hotels we stayed in Madrid, Seville and Barcelona, we thought Preciados was the best. Rooms were clean, hotel very centrally located. Hotel was very close to the metro stations, staff spoke good english and very helpful. We were traveling with my daughter age 7 and this was the only hotel in our stay in spain that didn't charge us for the extra bed. Also there were 2 computers in the hotel that we could access internet freely.
reviews.title: Loved it, great value and location

reviews.text: We didn't try the restaurant but there were a lot of eating places including late night tapas bars very closeby.
reviews.title: Good for groups

likes.liked: — All our group liked it. Usually a difficult thing to do in a group.

reviews.text: Very tidy & clean. Not far from the city centre attractions. Restaurant was good. They let us stay until closing time. A good italian eatery next door and a funky little bar 50 yards away for a 'nightcap'. You won't be dissapointed.
reviews.title: Superb Hotel in a great location

reviews.text: We started and ended our 3 week European Vacation in Madrid at Hotel Preciados. We can not say enough about the Hotel, the staff, the service , the breakfast's, the location it was all first class. From the moment we arrived and were greeted by the Reception Desk ( Christina) to the restaurant and lounge staff who were over the top with their service and friendliness. The Sr Waiter was a very very nice man who made us feel welcome each time we came back to the hotel at the end of a long day of sightseeing. We went on a Med Cruise for 2 weeks and then came back to Hotel Preciados and the Sr Waiter and the Receptionist staff all welcomed us back as if we were long lost relatives. Both stays we stayed in the Suites which were very clean and roomy, and included complimentary beverages.Location is great close to so much and no need to take transit. We would certainly recommend and would definitely stay again if in Madrid.
reviews.title: European Vacation Sept-Oct 2012

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is very good and the front desk people were able to suggest things, give directions, hold luggage. The restaurant is also good, though a bit expensive. Second time we stayed we got upgraded to a fabulous suite. Laundry is pricey here and everywhere--bring your drip dryables.
reviews.title: Great location and helpful staff--and good food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've just returned from a 4 week trip to Spain and France and I have to say that this hotel was by far the best hotel we stayed in during this trip. The location and service from the staff is excellent. The room, despite not having a "view" was exactly what we needed -very clean, quiet, comfortable, with a great bathroom and the free minibar was such a bonus! We didn't have a mobile phone or computer with us (I know, that makes us very "strange") but we had access to the 2 free computers in the hotel which allowed us to contact family if needed during our 3 night stay there. I'm not a breakfast person but I loved the selection on offer - Oh, that Iberian jamon and Spanish omelettes were divine! We ate at the hotel's restaurant every night simply because it was wonderful food and not expensive. We ended up chatting on 2 nights to others in the restaurant who were staying at nearby hotels but chose to eat at this restaurant because it was so much better than the restaurants at their hotels.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only "fault" is that there was no kettle in the room - as an Aussie, I love to be able to have a cuppa in my hotel room. I did ask the reception staff for a kettle (I carry teabags with me) but was told that they don't have kettles to give to guests. They did offer to bring up hot water if I required it but I didn't feel comfortable about making that call late at night, simply because I wanted a cuppa before bed.
reviews.title: great trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only other thing is that we didn't realise there were remote controlled shutters on the windows until the 2nd night, when another guest, with whom we were chatting in the restaurant, mentioned that he had only discovered the controls the night before and told us where to find them. Perhaps, the reception staff should mention this to clients as they check in.
reviews.title: Amazing hotel, service and location

reviews.text: We spent two nights at the Hotel Preciados after reading about it on Trip Advisor and we could not have been more pleased. The room was immaculate and spacious. The staff could not have been friendlier or more helpful to us during our stay, and although we prefer to walk rather than use public transportation, the hotel was close to the transportation systems. We would definitely stay at this hotel again!
reviews.title: classy and good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed for a week at the Hotel Preciados in September 2004. Being forewarned not to let the taxi drop us at the end of the pedestrian mall, we were driven to the hotel entrance on a narrow side street. The reception was efficient and our rooftop room with balcony and large bath with whirlpool tub was great. There was no scenic view; instead have lunch at the top of Ingles department store nearby for a city view. Be aware that the "suites" are still small by American standards, but still larger than most. The small in-room frig was kept filled each day with cold beverages at no charge. The staff we dealt with were not strongly proficient in English, but skilled enough to direct us where to find what we were looking for. The Plaza Mayor, the Palace, and great shopping were all within easy walking distance as well as several great restaurants. Everything else was accessible via the subway only five minutes away by foot. A small but excellent restaurant adjoins the hotel.
reviews.title: Great location for central Madrid

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice hotel with wonderful staff. Near all the major sites of the old city. Double rooms have chaming balconies and slanted celings. Hotel is newish and immaculately clean. Breakfast is good but very over priced - go out the door and you'll find dozens of nice cafes. I'd stay here again .
reviews.title: Nice little hotel

reviews.text: If you are looking for a well placed, well run and value for money hotel in the centre of Madrid I would highly recommend that you consider the Hotel Preciados.
reviews.title: Highly Recommendable in the heart of Madrid

likes.liked: — Stylish, clean, quiet, centrally placed, well run, reasonably priced.
likes.disliked: — This is a good hotel which when I go back to Madrid I will stay at.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Preciados is situated in a quiet road literally a 5-6 min stroll to the Plaza P. del Sol in the one direction and down the hill to the Opera house in the other direction. The Prado museum takes about 15 minutes to walk to and you have the underground station nearby. You cannot get more central in Madrid. We received the help we needed from the hotel staff who as far as I could judge spoke reasonable english.
reviews.title: Great stay!

reviews.text: The 4* hotel has a minimalistic style which pleased all of the 16 strong group of "mature" teachers, of which I was one. We have travelled around europe both as a group and as individuals and know a little about hotels. This hotel rates up in the top bracket.
reviews.title: A very pleasant stay indeed

likes.liked: — Secure Car Park and the free mini bar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As I was researching hotels for our weekend in Madrid, I read reviews on multiple properties. I always stay Marriott (JW, Marriott, or Renaissance), so I was a little nervous to stay at a 'non-chain'. Hotel Preciados was as good and better as all the positive reviews I read. The rooms very nice and clean, staff helpful and knowledgeable, and in a great location. I will definitely choose the Hotel Preciados for our next stay in Madrid.
reviews.title: Wonderful Weekend!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In the heart of the old city, Preciados is close to everything and very comfortable. Staff was attentive and helpful, rooms were just right by Europe standards and had a modern elegance. You are in walking distance of the best Tapas spots, the Theatro Espagne, and shopping. A little touristy, but being tourists, just what we needed.
reviews.title: Great spot in Madrid
10 year Anniversary Break
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Precadios between 30/10/12 and 02/11/12. We found the hotel comfortable, in an excellent location, with good breakfast. Highly recommended. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Excellent base for a holiday in Madrid.
We phoned ahead to help with our arrival by car. The staff gave very good directions and as the hotel was in a square, we were told just park out the front and we will take car of your car.
reviews.title: Excellent Service

reviews.text: The rooms were very good as was the bar service.
reviews.title: Excellent find!

reviews.text: We stayed for 5 nights in two rooms for our family of 5. The Preciados was perfect for our family. The rooms were clean, quiet and comfortable. The staff was friendly, helpful and professional. The location was perfect, close to sites, metro, shopping but not in the heart of the really busy pedestrian area. I would highly recommend the Preciados for any family, just asked to have the porn on your TV blocked!!
reviews.title: Just right!

reviews.text: Fab location - walked wherever we wanted to go. Clean, stylish room - wood, marble, crisp white sheets - but ask for a room with a view as ours had none! Appreciated free minibar. staff helpful. As noted in other reviews - breakfast expensive. Helpful staff - booking excursions etc. Recommended!
reviews.title: Understated elegance, central, helpful staff
Ideal Lodgings
reviews.text: We have just returned from Madrid where we were fortunate enough to stay at the Preciados. The location is central, within easy reach of the Palace and the Prado and right next to a very busy shopping precinct. There are many eating places and bars within walking distance. The hotel itself is modern with some character and has adequately sized rooms and good bathrooms. The staff were friendly and helpful. Just a little warning about Madrid in general. We found the lack of those speaking English quite a challenge but the Madrillenos are friendly and will go along with the odd word and the holding up of fingers to indicate numbers. Madrid, however, is a beautiful city and well worth a visit.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel through booking.com and made our choice because of the reviews on this site. The hotel is simple. There are no frills, no bar, etc. It is a clean nice hotel in the center of everything.
reviews.title: Simple Hotel in the center of everything!

likes.liked: — Proximity to everything and free minibar & Internet access
likes.disliked: — lighting in the room wasn't the best but we'd still stay there again!

reviews.title: Liked Preciados A Lot
reviews.text: The bed was comfortable, the towels were nice, the bathroom was a good size. There are double glaze windows plus automatic blinds so you can't hear the street and if you stay up partying too late one night, the room will stay dark & quiet!!

We were pleasantly surprised with our room. The room was large with a desk and extra floor space. The bed was a comfortable queen-sized mattress and not two twins pushed together. The bathroom was large with a big countertop, nice tub/shower. The room rate included free wifi and unlimited use of the mini bar. The best part for me was the electric room-darkening shades from Madrid's night lights! Great hotel in a great location.
reviews.title: Our most spacious hotel room in Spain

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thank you to the wonderful, friendly, attentive and professional staff and especially the food and beverage staff. We had the best time, thank you. Whilst our room was slightly on the small size it was certainly comfortable. The hotel is well located. The restaurant serves great cuisine - try the "pimientos asados con anchoas" "roasted peppers with anchovies" for starters then the duck confit or beef tenderloin with Padron peppers for main. Serves tend to be on the large side. Finish off with a lemon sherbet. Of a late afternoon sit outside and watch the passing parade - of course whilst sipping a very dry martini. And the shopping is just around the corner. We loved Spain and will be back - Thank you Preciados for your contribution to a memorable stay in Madrid.
reviews.title: the best of our Europe holiday

reviews.text: I stayed here with a group of 4 girls for a 40th birthday celebration. The Hotel was exactly what we had hoped for. Excellent location, with bars and breakfast places available nearby and a short walk from everything else that a tourist would need. We met a group for a Tapas and Tavernas evening and this was well worth doing, it made us try things we wouldnt have tasted if we were on our own and was the highlight of the trip. The hotel was clean and modern and I was very happy with my accomodation. Just one point to note, my friends room did not have an external window, so just be clear what you are booking. Would I recommend the Hotel Preciados....I certainly would
reviews.title: Excellent location for a girly weekend - just a note on the room types

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We started our trip to Spain in Madrid. We have Spanish friends who recommended hotels in either the Salamanca area of Madrid or the Westin Palace. We are so glad that we choose the Preciados instead. It is a centrally located hotel - near the Plaza Sol - but on a quiet street. Our room was modern without being cold or sparse. It helped to set the tone of our trip to Spain. It was close enough to downtown so we could get up and have coffee roaming the streets of downtown or walk to Mercado San Miguel for dessert at night. But it was quiet enough to rest at the end of the day. And it did not have the stuffiness of some of the luxury hotels in town. We did not interact with the staff that much (except for Nelson at the lovely restaurant (great lunch)) but when we did they were helpful and efficient.
reviews.title: Wonderful place to start our trip

reviews.text: We visited 5 more cities in Spain after Madrid. We looked for hotels with similar attributes to the Preciados but were unable to duplicate the combination of price, location and warmth. We either had to stay in much more expensive 5-star hotels or stay in hotels while still clean and comfortable had little charm.
reviews.title: Great location

description: A Modern Boutique 4**** Hotel, located in the main shopping street in Madrid: Calle Preciados. From its unbeatable location, between PLAZA ESPAÑA – GRAN VÍA – PASEO DEL PRADO – PUERTA DEL SOL and PLAZA MAYOR, our guests will be able to enjoy the most attractive cultural and shopping delights in Madrid. FREE MINIBAR and WIFI in all rooms.Tranquility, courtesy, elegance and comfort are just some of the charms and qualities that characterize the Hotel Preciados.
